intro: Thalictrum minus proles sabaudum, commonly known as the Sabaudian meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short flowering period in early spring and is often found in association with other woodland flora. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
